Authors: Kibtiah T.M., Miranda E., Fernando Y., Aryuni M.
Title: Terrorism, social media and text mining technique: Review of six years past studies
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, International Relations Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, 26300, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Kibtiah, T.M., Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, International Relations Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Miranda, E., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, Y., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia, Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, 26300, Malaysia; Aryuni, M., Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, International Relations Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to examine the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS) recruitment actual behavior through social media. The ISIS has targeted Indonesia as the main source of participants due to the large of Muslim community with active internet users. Despite many ways to connect with social media like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube using videos and images, this paper is selected text as the main of source of materials. This paper is deployed a qualitative technique to analyze related literature and then it was combined with media tracking systems from texts posted on Twitter, Facebook, Website, and Telegram. The text mining was captured words that frequently appears that mentioned their support to the ISIS accounts from 2011 to 2017. This paper found that Indonesian tends to pay more attention to the existence of ISIS in Syria. This paper suggests that the Indonesian related agency to closely monitor the accounts which positively associated with ISIS terrorism and propaganda and take necessary action to clean up the massive haywire issues. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ISIS; Recruitment; Social media; Terrorism; Text mining
Index Keywords: Information management; Social networking (online); Terrorism; Facebook; Indonesia; Internet users; Media tracking; Social media; Text mining techniques; YouTube; Text mining

Authors: Miranda E., Aryuni M., Fernando Y., Kibtiah T.M.
Title: A study of radicalism contents detection in twitter: Insights from support vector machine technique
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, International Relations Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Miranda, E., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aryuni, M., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, Y., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Kibtiah, T.M., Bina Nusantara University, International Relations Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Social media has been widely used to target, coordinate, disseminate and embed radicalism doctrine to the society. Radicalism gives destructive impacts to an attacked country and the global society. It is not only makes a serious threat to a nation unity, yet it also impacts the cultural, socio-political, and economic among the others. This study is aim to study radicalism intention using content detection. The model was developed using social media content like posting, comment and conversation to indicate the level of radicalism. Data was collected from a Twitter. It has chosen as a social media platform because Twitter can engage the community with powerful and impactful microblogging function. The data was analyzed using machine learning. To be specifically, a Support Vector Machine (SVM) in text mining employed for classification of Twitter's content in national language of republic Indonesia. There were two focus keywords used in this study. The first one is ISIS and follow by Syria. The result shows that 83.3% accuracy of test set tuples, 90% part of the contents indicates positive link to radicalism with no-radicalism class as a precision value. Besides recall value was calculated for accuracy, 95% and 82% part of actual text positively link as radicalism class with a proxy of no-radicalism class. This model is hoped to detect and overcome the terrorism issue in Indonesia. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Machine learning; Radicalism; Support vector machine; Terrorism; Twitter
Index Keywords: Information management; Social aspects; Social networking (online); Text mining; Content detection; Global society; Microblogging; National language; Social media; Social media platforms; Support vector machine techniques; Test sets; Support vector machines

Authors: Aryuni M., Miranda E., Fernando Y., Kibtiah T.M.
Title: An early warning detection system of terrorism in indonesia from twitter contents using naïve bayes Algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, International Relations Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, 26300, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Aryuni, M., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Miranda, E., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, Y., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia, Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, 26300, Malaysia; Kibtiah, T.M., Bina Nusantara University, International Relations Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Aware on the benefits of social media as the networking platform, the extremist organization is utilized social media to spread the ideology, recruit new member and guided a suicide bomber alike. There are opportunities to analyze the content of document texts in social media including the terrorism detection and intention by extracting the content evident in their post, comment etc. The objective of this research is to analyze content posted in Twitter and to review whether post and conversation on Twitter will be highly related to terrorism intention or another way around. This study deployed Naïve Bayes classification technique which identified Twitter contents in Indonesian national language. The method has been processed text pre-processing, and dataset divided with hold out technique. Result of F-measure value indicates that 76% and 77% of texts are associated with the accuracy level of terrorism based on macro-averaging and micro-averaging indicators. The finding is contributed to the scanty literature on the early warning detection method in Indonesian language and assist the government to target the extremists' organizations. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Naïve Bayes; Terroris; Text categorization; Twitter
Index Keywords: Information management; Terrorism; Accuracy level; Bayes algorithms; Bayes classification; Detection methods; Detection system; Indonesian languages; National language; Pre-processing; Social networking (online)
